content:
I would like to redesign the Organization Profile Page. I felt like the User profile is well structured and elements arranged properly but in Organization profile elements are not well structured
I did some design figma Design
changes
1) Org Profile picture is in the right corner exactly like user Profile Picture and gets rid of button and upload triggered by clicking on the widget itself, deletion using X icon exactly like User Avatar deletion
2)Organization Description box size decreased since it occupies more space even the description in very less which can be an auto-increment in size based on the length of the description
3) Separated Day Mode and night mode Organization logo
4) Removed logo upload button and delete logo button.upload logo triggered by clicking on the logo respectively and deletion using "X" icon
@Tim Abbott Your opinion about this?

@Jagan S interesting thoughts! A few thoughts:

  • I'm not sure about the organization icon idea; the thing is, organization icons are never displayed at a large size like the user avatar is, and we expect a resolution of ~100x100; so I think it will basically always look bad/pixelated.
  • The organization logo stuff is nice, but we'll need to make sure it falls back properly in the event that the window is narrow
  • For "organization description", what I'd really like to do is show the rendered-markdown description by default, and only if the user clicks an edit widget should it switch to an editable mode (which could be in a modal or something).
@Tim Abbott for organization icon, I mainly cared about the position of the organization icon we could reduce the size. is it ok to place the organization icon widget in the right corner?
We can try it; I'd want to look at a screenshot for whether it looks broken.
Also, I think having a larger description box is a good idea, because it encourages longer descriptions... But I don't think it's a hard requirement.
With my proposed change, the sizing of the description box would be driven mainly by how it looks when displayed on the login page.
